Description:
The FRSS Global Data Governance Lead is a key position responsible for the development, framework buildout and oversight of a data governance program for data that FRSS owns and / or uses.  Given the importance of data in the end to end financial and risk reporting processes, the data governance lead is a strategic role that will partner with Finance Data Domain owner(s) on all issues related to identification of data quality issues, IMRs and remediation of data quality issues. Key responsibilities include but is not limited to:Plan, provide oversight, and drive adoption of data strategy for FRSS in partnership with Finance, Chief Data Office, and EO&T Data Governance Officer
Develop a Data Governance and management strategy, framework, tools, and implementation plan for data used or owned by FRSS reporting operations teams
Provide guidance, direction, and oversight of FRSS compliance with Citi Data Management Policy, including things like CDE and IMR specific for FRSS reporting operations processes
Exercise governance over data related responsibilities for FRSS, e.g. when FRSS is report owner, report preparer, schedule owner, schedule preparer, or process owner, etc.
Implement a framework to identify and escalate data quality issues, ensure root cause analysis is performed timely, and monitor resolutionMonitor execution of data strategy and data controls for data that FRSS reporting operations owns or uses.  Monitor that FRSS data related controls, documentation, and procedures comply with established framework to mitigate key risksThe incumbent will directly manage a team of data governance professionals in the execution of robust data strategy, governance, and compliance.  Additional duties as follows: Build a high performing team of Data Governance analysts with the required leadership, influence, and analytical skills (hire, train, manage, oversee, etc.)
Develop and implement monitoring and reporting requirements including metrics i.e. heat maps, dashboards, Senior Management packages, monitoring, etc.  Reporting will be provided to Senior members of FRSS, including head of FRSS, FRSS global Risk Control lead, Reporting Operations Managers, FRSS Center Heads, Finance, CDGO, and EO&T as appropriate
Evaluate exposure of data quality deficiencies and ensure effective and timely control reporting and escalation
Prepare clear, concise and accurate documentation, reports of work performed and other written materials; read, interpret, explain and apply critical thinking.
Engage with senior management to report, escalate issues and review/present exceptions
Ensure departmental processes and procedures are implemented and kept current.
Ensure sufficient time zone coverage across North America, Costa Rica, Mumbai, and Manila to facilitate ongoing interaction with FRSS reporting operations teamsQualifications:The successful candidate will utilize an extensive, multi-disciplinary knowledge of data quality and data control concepts to implement a comprehensive data quality framework.  To qualify for this position, you must be a senior individual with a proven track record and have experience within the financial services industry and the following:Incumbent should have 10+ years of experience within the financial industry with data quality / data control background a+.
BS Business, Finance or Risk degree required
7+ years of management experience with proficiency in building teams.
Experience in working with a variety of financial platforms, good technical expertise; ability to manage a complex portfolio in a dynamic and changing environment.
Knowledge of data flows and working knowledge of financial institutions' products, businesses and functions; and reporting requirements
Experience with program planning and implementation skills.
Proficient in risk and control analysis and audit concepts and skilled at analyzing root causes of problems and anticipating emerging issues.
Knowledge of Citi Data Management Policy a +; Project/Program management experience a +Other Skills:Possess the ability to look at the big picture and is well versed in a ‘no surprise’ culture to be able to proactively engage stakeholders to mitigate risk.
Ability to develop and produce monthly metrics and identify trends and themes from high volume information sources and synthesize reports for easy consumption of senior managers.
Ability to establish and meet strict deadlines.
Excellent organizational skills; strong vocal leadership; ability to drive strategic change and possess superb problem-solving skills.
Demonstrate executive presence and organizational savvy.
Demonstrate facilitation, and partnering skills.
Candidate should be analytical, flexible, team-oriented, have good interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills with strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task.       
This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both written and verbal, with an energetic, charismatic and approachable style.
